result.title: Some Statistics About CF Rating Changes
result.content:
Overview

There are 1263879 rating changes in 745 rated contests (by 2018/03/15, including those mentioned in the "Something Weird" section). The overall average of deltas is -6.30274.

Rating Changes Distribution

(Well, it looks like a boa constrictor eating an elephant...)

10 Codeforces Round #323 (Div. 2) -18.305 4728

Rating: Sum, Average, Standard Deviation and Skewness

A user is included in the sum only after their first participation in a contest.
Note that we can observe changes of rating system (November 2011 and October 2015) on the graph.

(I wondered if there were changes in March 2012, since the top 5 contests with most negative average delta are all in March or April 2012. However, I didn't find any related posts.)

Something Weird

  1. In Codeforces Round #FF (Div. 2), kasim appeared in both #1095 and #1986.
  2. In Codeforces Round #270, yuki2006 appeared in both #2876 and #3520; a00920 appeared in both #1097 and #3602.
  3. In Codeforces Round #338 (Div. 2), bohuss appeared in both #256 and #3477; InnocentFool appeared in both #555 and #3477; elgris appeared in both #884 and #3477; Altitude appeared in both #2439 and #3477; mohamedazab appeared in both #2831 and #3477. (Such a buggy round?)
  4. In MemSQL Start[c]UP 2.0 - Round 2, FreezingCool had a rating change of +5, but it wasn't displayed on the user page. (Can somebody explain why max rating is smaller than contest rating?)
  5. In Технокубок 2018 - Отборочный Раунд 4, ilya140101 had a rating change of -83. However, it seems that the rating is not actually changed. After that, his ratings displayed on "contest rating" and "rating change" in contest pages was 83 higher than those on the user history graph.
  6. In contest pages, ratings less than 100 are displayed as 100. 5 users have been affected: worse, MisterMax, newbie314159, errorerror, and Mhammad1.
